concise_definition: v. 使正式加入, 任命, 使入会, 举行就职仪式

definitions.explanation_en: To formally admit someone into an organization, group, or position, often through a ceremony or official procedure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过正式仪式或程序将某人接纳进入某个组织、团体或职位。
definitions.example_en: She was inducted into the National Academy of Sciences in 2020.
definitions.example_cn: 她于2020年被选入美国国家科学院。

definitions.explanation_en: To formally introduce someone to the duties and responsibilities of a new role, especially in military or institutional contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指正式向某人介绍新角色的职责与义务，尤用于军事或机构环境中。
definitions.example_en: The new recruits were inducted into the army with a week of orientation.
definitions.example_cn: 新兵经过一周的入伍培训后正式加入军队。

definitions.explanation_en: To initiate someone into a secret society, fraternity, or group through a ritual or symbolic act.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过某种仪式或象征性行为将某人引入秘密社团、兄弟会或团体。
definitions.example_en: He was inducted into the fraternity with a series of traditional rites.
definitions.example_cn: 他通过一系列传统仪式被接纳为兄弟会成员。

comparison.analysis: “Appointed” (任命) 强调由权威方指定某人担任某一职位，通常不涉及仪式或加入过程，侧重于权力或职责的授予。而 “inducted” 更强调正式接纳和融入的过程，常伴随仪式或培训。
“Enrolled” (注册/登记) 通常用于教育或行政场景，指将某人列入名单或系统，过程较为程序化，缺乏仪式感。而 “inducted” 暗示更正式、更具象征意义的接纳，常用于组织、军队或精英团体。
“Initiated” (引入/启蒙) 与 “inducted” 非常接近，尤其在秘密社团或宗教语境中可互换。但 “initiated” 更强调知识或精神层面的启蒙，而 “inducted” 更侧重于制度性或组织性的正式加入。
